settings-text: My position is the lack of a position, but, of course, you can't even talk about it; the minute you talk, you spoil the whole game.

settings-text: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's there are few.
info-about: Archivo Black is a grotesque font and was originally designed for highlights and headlines. This family is reminiscent of late nineteenth century American typefaces.
info-family: Regular, Italic, Bold and Bold Italic

settings-text: One of the highest virtues of good typography is its subtle elegance.
info-about: Archivo Narrow Regular was designed to be used simultaneously in print and digital platforms. The technical and aesthetic characteristics of this typeface are both crafted for high performance typography.
info-family: Regular, Italic, Bold and Bold Italic

settings-text: It is not the duty of the typographer to consciously display or emulate the style of current trends, not to reflect the spirit of the times.
info-about: Bagnard Regular was inspired by the graffitis of an anonymous prisoner of the napoleonic wars.
info-family: Regular

font-creator: Doug Thomas, Chris Fodge and May Kim
settings-text: Design must be functional and functionality must be translated into visual aesthetics, without any reliance on gimmicks that have to be explained.
info-about: Bagnard Sans Regular was originally created by Sebastien Sanfilippo called 'Bagnard' and is a modification without serifs.
info-family: Regular

settings-text: I have forced myself to contradict myself in order to avoid conforming to my own taste.
info-about: Bluu Next Bold is sharp and precise, a totally good choice to replace any boring serif font like the Times.
info-family: Regular

settings-text: Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world.
info-about: Cooper Hewitt Heavy, is a contemporary sans serif, with characters composed of modified-geometric curves and arches. Initially commissioned by Pentagram to evolve his Polaris Condensed typeface, Chester Jenkins created a new digital form to support the newly transformed museum. “Developing this typeface specifically for Cooper Hewitt has been enormously gratifying,” said Jenkins. “Instead of building on the Polaris structures, I drew everything from scratch, using the existing forms as a rough guide for letter widths and master-stroke thicknesses.”
info-family: Thin, Thin Italic, Light, Light Italic, Book, Book Italic, Medium, Medium Italic, Semibold, Semibold Italic, Bold, Bold Italic, Heavy and Heavy Italic

settings-text: The future is already here – it's just not evenly distributed.
info-about: Cotham Regular is a sans serif grotesk.
info-family: Regular

settings-text: The art of storytelling is reaching its end because the epic side of truth, wisdom, is dying out.
info-about: EB Garamond Regular is on cut out of a family of an open source project to create a revival of Claude Garamont’s famous humanist typeface from the mid-16th century. Its design reproduces the original design by Claude Garamont: The source for the letterforms is a scan of a specimen known as the “Berner specimen”, which, composed in 1592 by Conrad Berner, son-in-law of Christian Egenolff and his successor at the Egenolff print office, shows Garamont’s roman and Granjon’s italic fonts at different sizes. Hence the name of this project: Egenolff-Berner Garamond.
info-family: Regular

settings-text: What the eyes see and the ears hear, the mind believes.
info-about: Gap Sans Bold is based on the Sani Trixie Sans Regular concoté by GrandChaos9000 and re-interpreted in the manner of Kawamata.
info-family: Regular, Bold and Black

settings-text: Everything you can imagine is real.
info-about: Inter is a typeface carefully crafted & designed for computer screens.
info-family: Regular

settings-text: Art is the highest form of hope.
info-about: Junicode Bold Condensed is designed to meet the needs of medieval scholars. However, it has a large enough character set to be useful to the general user. The Regular face has the fullest character set and is richest in OpenType features.
info-family: Regular, Italic, Bold, Bold Italic, Condensed and Condensed Italic

settings-text: It doesn't matter how many times you fail. You only have to be right once and then everyone can tell you that you are an overnight success.
info-about: League Gothic is a revival of an old classic, and one of our favorite typefaces, Alternate Gothic #1. It was originally designed by Morris Fuller Benton for the American Type Founders Company in 1903. The company went bankrupt in 1993, and since the original typeface was created before 1923, the typeface is in the public domain.
info-family: Regular, Italic, Condensed Regular and Condensed Italic

settings-text: Everything I do references something that influenced me.
info-about: Liberation Sans Bold is a font which aims at metric compatibility with Arial, Times New Roman, and Courier New.
info-family: Regular, Italic, Bold and Bold Italic

settings-text: People do not buy goods and services. They buy relations, stories, and magic.
info-about: Libre Baskerville Regular is a webfont family optimized for body text. It's Based on 1941 ATF Baskerville Specimens but it has a taller x-height, wider counters and less contrast that allow it to work on small sizes in any screen.
info-family: Regular, Italic and Bold

settings-text: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
info-about: M+ M Type One Light is not only a monospace font, yet it is a multilingual, multi-weight and a multi-style font family developed mainly for Kana and Kanji.
info-family: Thin, Light, Regular, Medium and Bold

settings-text: The best typography is invisible to the reader and serves to transmit the thoughts and intent of the author.
info-about: Nimbus Sans L Bold is a version of Nimbus Sans using Adobe font sources. It was designed in 1987. The family includes 17 fonts in 5 weights and 2 widths, with Nimbus Sans L Extra Black only available in condensed roman format.
info-family: Regular, Regular Italic, Regular Condensed, Regular Condensed Italic, Bold, Bold Italic and Bold Condensed Italic

settings-text: Good typography has absolutely nothing to do with remarkable or exotic type styles. This is the opinion of amateurs.
info-about: Office Code Pro Light is a customized version of Source Code Pro, the monospaced sans serif originally created by Paul D. Hunt for Adobe Systems Incorporated. The customizations were made specifically for text editors and coding environments, but are still very usable in other applications.
info-family: Light, Light Italic, Regular, Regular Italic, Medium, Medium Italic, Bold and Bold Italic

settings-text: If something is not good enough, stop doing it.
info-about: Ostrich Sans Heavy is a gorgeous modern sans serif with a very long neck.
info-family: Dashed Thin, Rounded Medium, Ultra Light, Normal, Bold, Black, Inline, Inline Italics and Heavy Round

settings-text: I Miss My Pre-Internet Brain.
info-about: Oswald Bold is a reworking of the classic gothic typeface style historically represented by designs such as 'Alternate Gothic'. The characters of Oswald have been re-drawn and reformed to better fit the pixel grid of standard digital screens. Oswald is designed to be used freely across the internet by web browsers on desktop computers, laptops and mobile devices.
info-family: ExtraLight, ExtraLight Italic, Light, Light Italic, Regular, Regular Italic, Medium, Medium Italic, DemiBold, DemiBold Italic, Bold, Bold Italic, Heavy and Heavy Italic

settings-text: A good engineer thinks in reverse and asks himself about the stylistic consequences of the components and systems he proposes.
info-about: Geometric sans serif typefaces have been a popular design element ever since these actors took to the world’s stage. Poppins Medium is one of the newest comer to this long tradition. An open source family supporting both Devanagari and Latin, this typeface is an internationalist take on the geometric sans genre. Many of the Latin glyphs — the ampersand, for instance — are far more constructed and rationalist than in previously released geometric typefaces. Poppins’s Devanagari design is particularly new. It is likely the first-ever large Devanagari family in this style that has been brought to market.
info-family: Light, Regular, Medium, SemiBold and Bold

settings-text: He who says he can and he who says he can't, are both usually right.
info-about: Reglo Bold is a geometric sans serif. It was initially designed for the identity of Radio Panik with Open Source Publishing.
info-family: Regular

settings-text: I don’t spend my time pontificating about high-concept things; I spend my time solving engineering and manufacturing problems.
info-about: Roboto Black Italic is from Google’s signature family of fonts, the default font on Android and ChromeOS, and the recommended font for Google’s visual language, Material Design. Roboto has a dual nature. It has a mechanical skeleton and the forms are largely geometric. At the same time, the font features friendly and open curves. While some grotesks distort their letterforms to force a rigid rhythm, Roboto doesn’t compromise, allowing letters to be settled into their natural width. This makes for a more natural reading rhythm more commonly found in humanist and serif types.
info-family: Thin, Thin Italic, Light, Light Italic, Normal, Normal Italic, Medium, Medium Italic, Bold, Bold Italic, Ultra-Bold and Ultra-Bold Italic

settings-text: One man’s “magic” is another man’s engineering. “Supernatural” is a null word.
info-about: Roboto Black Thin is from Google’s signature family of fonts, the default font on Android and ChromeOS, and the recommended font for Google’s visual language, Material Design. Roboto has a dual nature. It has a mechanical skeleton and the forms are largely geometric. At the same time, the font features friendly and open curves. While some grotesks distort their letterforms to force a rigid rhythm, Roboto doesn’t compromise, allowing letters to be settled into their natural width. This makes for a more natural reading rhythm more commonly found in humanist and serif types.
info-family: Thin, Thin Italic, Light, Light Italic, Normal, Normal Italic, Medium, Medium Italic, Bold, Bold Italic, Ultra-Bold and Ultra-Bold Italic

settings-text: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.

settings-text: Coming together is a beginning. Keeping together is progress. Working together is success.
info-about: TeX Gyre Heros Bold Italic is based on the URW Nimbus Sans L kindly released by URW++ Design and Development Inc. under GFL. The Vietnamese glyphs were added by Han The Thanh. TeX Gyre Heros can be used as a replacement for the popular font Helvetica, which is also known as Swiss (prepared by Max Miedinger with Eduard Hoffmann, 1957, at the Haas Type Foundry).
info-family: Regular, Italic, Bold, Bold Italic, Condensed Regular, Condensed Italic, Condensed Bold and Condensed Bold Italic

settings-text: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
info-about: TeX Gyre Heros Condensed Regular is based on the URW Nimbus Sans L kindly released by URW++ Design and Development Inc. under GFL (independently of the GPL release accompanying Ghostscript). The Vietnamese glyphs were added by Han The Thanh. TeX Gyre Heros can be used as a replacement for a popular font Helvetica, also known as Swiss (prepared by Max Miedinger with Eduard Hoffmann, 1957, at the Haas Type Foundry).
info-family: Regular, Italic, Bold, Bold Italic, Condensed Regular, Condensed Italic, Condensed Bold and Condensed Bold Italic

settings-text: You cannot understand good design if you do not understand people.
info-about: Work Sans Extra Bold is a typeface based loosely on early Grotesques, such as those by Stephenson Blake, Miller & Richard and Bauerschen Giesserei. The Regular weight and others in the middle of the family are optimised for on-screen text usage at medium-sizes (14px-48px) and can also be used in print design. The fonts closer to the extreme weights are designed more for display use both on the web and in print. Overall, features are simplified and optimised for screen resolutions; for example, diacritic marks are larger than how they would be in print.
info-family: Thin, ExtraLight, Light, Normal, Medium, SemiBold, Bold, ExtraBold and UltraBold

settings-text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
info-about: Work Sans Light is a typeface based loosely on early Grotesques, such as those by Stephenson Blake, Miller & Richard and Bauerschen Giesserei. The Regular weight and others in the middle of the family are optimised for on-screen text usage at medium-sizes (14px-48px) and can also be used in print design. The fonts closer to the extreme weights are designed more for display use both on the web and in print. Overall, features are simplified and optimised for screen resolutions; for example, diacritic marks are larger than how they would be in print.
info-family: Thin, ExtraLight, Light, Normal, Medium, SemiBold, Bold, ExtraBold and UltraBold

settings-text: I am a great admirer of mystery and magic. Look at this life - all mystery and magic.
